title: Get all replies to a comment

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Access token authorized by TikTok creators. To obtain an access token, use /tt_user/oauth2/token/ .

parameters.name: business_id
parameters.description: Application specific unique identifier for the TikTok account. Pass the value of the open_id field returned in the response of /tt_user/oauth2/token/ to this field.

parameters.name: video_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for owned TikTok video to list comments on. This can be accessed via the /business/video/list/ endpoint as the item_id for each video listed.

parameters.name: comment_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for comment on an owned TikTok video to list replies on. This can be accessed via the /business/comment/list/ endpoint as the comment_id for each comment listed.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Enumerated status of comment reply visibility. Enum values : PUBLIC : Comment replies are publicly viewable by all TikTok users. ALL : Comment replies are both hidden from view as well as publicly viewable by all TikTok users. Default value : ALL .

parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.description: Specific field to sort comment replies by. Enum values : likes : Sort comment replies by the number of likes in the specified sort_order . replies : Sort comment replies by the number of replies in the specified sort_order . create_time : Sort comment replies chronologically in the specified sort_order . By default, the comment replies will be returned in a random order.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specific field to sort comment replies by. Enum values : asc : Sort comment replies in ascending order by the specified sort_field . desc : Sort comment replies in descending order by the specified sort_field . By default, the comment replies will be sorted according to semantics.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination. If the response parameter has_more is true, pass the returned cursor in this parameter in the subsequent request to receive the next page of results. Default value : 0.

parameters.name: max_count
parameters.description: The maximum number of comment replies that will be returned for each page of data. Default value : 20. Minimum value : 0. Maximum value : 30. Note : Due to our trust and safety policies, it is possible that the endpoint returns less than the max_count number of comments even if the response parameter has_more is true.
